Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump JI to get the Lazy initialization in JniRuntime improvement" (#2716) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "[docs] Update the build instructions for Windows" (#2656) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://gitter.im/xamarin/xamarin-android?at=5c4a25ba7a0f4d5b1900f7a4
Context: https://gitter.im/xamarin/xamarin-android?at=5c4a9d968ce4bb25b80795d3

Add environment setup instructions to make it easier for contributors to
make sure they have a Windows build environment that has the expected
build dependencies.  The instructions were a little confusing before
this because the [Build Dependencies][0] page doesn't have a dedicated
section about Windows.

Add a link to the [Using Your Build][1] page to make it easier for
contributors to find the next step about how to build a Xamarin.Android
application after they have built `Xamarin.Android.sln`.

Mention the (relatively new) `Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks.sln` as a way
to work around output assembly file locking when working on the build
tasks on Windows.

[0]: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/Documentation/building/dependencies.md
[1]: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/Documentation/workflow/UsingYourBuild.md

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] The instruction pointer of the currently executing method is not on the recorded stack" (#5195) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

I got an error when clearing the binding ObservableCollection (run myCollection.Clear()) in page's OnAppearing() method.
The following error is thrown. It stops the following process to update the ObservableCollection. And the listview which binding the collection is not updated.

Thread finished: <Thread Pool> #29[0xb6ff3bec] The instruction pointer of the currently executing method(Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject:ApplyBindings (bool,bool)) is not on the recorded stack. This is likely due to a runtime bug. 


### Steps to Reproduce

1. The first time when the ListView is rendered, no errors. Items are added to the ObservableCollection.
2. Navigate to other pages, then go back the page.  
3. The ListView is loaded again. And the above error appears.

### Expected Behavior
The collection's clear method can run without errors. 

### Actual Behavior
Error thrown.
Thread finished: <Thread Pool> #29[0xb6ff3bec] The instruction pointer of the currently executing method(Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject:ApplyBindings (bool,bool)) is not on the recorded stack. This is likely due to a runtime bug. 

### Basic Information
Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 
Version 15.9.4
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.9.4+28307.222
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03056

Installed Version: Enterprise

Mono Debugging for Visual Studio   4.13.12-pre (9bc9548)

NuGet Package Manager   4.6.0

TypeScript Tools   15.9.20918.2001
TypeScript Tools for Microsoft Visual Studio

Xamarin   4.12.3.77 (d15-9@e3f40b477)
Visual Studio extension to enable development for Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Android.

Xamarin Designer   4.16.13 (45a16efd4)
Visual Studio extension to enable Xamarin Designer tools in Visual Studio.

Xamarin Templates   1.1.128 (6f5ebb2)
Templates for building iOS, Android, and Windows apps with Xamarin and Xamarin.Forms.

Xamarin.Android SDK   9.1.4.2 (HEAD/8255f42fc)
Xamarin.Android Reference Assemblies and MSBuild support.

Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Mac SDK   12.2.1.12 (65ec520)
Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Mac Reference Assemblies and MSBuild support.


Xamarin.Forms: 3.3

Target Framework: Android 8.1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Visual] Material Pickers and Added a Sandbox App" (#5194) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
Visual material implementation for the entry fields that are used for pickers. The pickers themselves are still native but this PR now makes the *textfields* use the same material design between iOS and Android

This PR also adds a Sandbox project which greatly improves the development loop. It deploys to android in about 14 seconds vs the 40 seconds required for Control Gallery so it's much quicker to iterate with.

It's also a more friendly place for people to tinker with the source code

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #5010 

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

Android Material vs Default
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/52540553-ff42b300-2d47-11e9-80bb-9409ea9b545d.png)

iOS Material vs Default
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/52540941-8a25ac80-2d4c-11e9-8b82-e35eae622e0b.png)



### Testing Procedure ###
Run Visual Gallery and test out the pickers.
Compare iOS and Android

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Building 3.5.0 fails on MonoAndroid81" (#5178) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
running **.create-nuget.bat droidios** after Visual Studio 2017 does a full Solution build (any cpu) on **3.5.0** results in the error:

> 
> 'msbuild' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
> operable program or batch file.
> 'msbuild' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
> operable program or batch file.
> Attempting to build package from 'Xamarin.Forms.nuspec'.
> Could not find a part of the path 'e:\GitHub\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android\bin\debug\MonoAndroid81'.

**Doing the same under 3.4.0 works fine and a nuget package is made that works.**

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Delete all repo folders locally
2. Use the GitHub client to get the latest
3. Switch to 3.5.0 branch
4. Open VS2017 => Xamarin.Forms.sln
5. Switch to Any CPU, build the solution
6. Run **.create-nuget.bat droidios**

### Expected Behavior

A nuget package created

### Actual Behavior
> 'msbuild' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
> operable program or batch file.
> 'msbuild' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
> operable program or batch file.
> Attempting to build package from 'Xamarin.Forms.nuspec'.
> Could not find a part of the path 'e:\GitHub\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android\bin\debug\MonoAndroid81'.

### Basic Information

Version 15.9.6
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.9.6+28307.344
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03056

Installed Version: Enterprise

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[interpreter]AudioGenerator sample fails to launch with System.ArrayTypeMismatchException" (#5363) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Install Xamarin.iOS build from master branch, 12.7.0.30 (master): aa77c673c)  or latest Version: 12.7.0.35 (Visual Studio Enterprise), Hash: 327c0a8d
2. Build and run AudioGenerator sample on a 64 bit device in debug mode.

### Expected Behavior
App builds and launches successfully
### Actual Behavior
App builds successfully but fail to launch with a System.ArrayTypeMismatch Exception. 
Unhandled Exception:
System.ArrayTypeMismatchException: Attempted to access an element as a type incompatible with the array.
### Environment

```
### Environment ###
Operating System: Mac OS X 10.14.1
Mono version: 5.18.0.225 (bac9fc1f889)  (2018-12-21 11:33:29 -05:00)
XA version: 
XI version: 12.7.0.35 (master): 327c0a8d) 
XM version: 5.2.1.12 (65ec520f)  (2018-12-05 12:06:09 -05:00)
XVS version: 
XS version: 7.8.0.1487 (0311f28)  (2018-12-19 13:37:11 -05:00)
[Device] Name: XQAiPhoneXb, Identifier: e978c67571aa0652bdb4ad6b8338ec46633e07ef
```

### Build Logs

<!--
1. Place cursor below this comment block.
2. Attach build log or link to gist (https://gist.github.com/) of the log.
-->
Build Log: https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/7a3cc9409fe1cf257e1bf62456ba1bf2
Exception log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-98e83226406b46d891d1ff99b5f0087b.txt

### Example Project (If Possible)

https://github.com/xamarin/ios-samples/tree/master/AudioGenerator

###Additional info:
App launches if interpreter is not enabled.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MSBuild PropertyListEditor task doesn't work" (#5579) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Closed issue "[interpreter]Debugging sample crashes when interpreter is enabled" (#5381) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Xamarin.iOS master, Version: 12.7.0.35 (Visual Studio Enterprise) 327c0a8d
2.  Set a breakpoint against Line7 in ClassesUnderTest/SimpleBreakpoints.cs
2. Build and deploy cross platform debugging app on device with interpreter enabled for iOS.Debugging.
3. GoTo SimpleBreakPoint and click Start

### Expected Behavior
Breakpoint should get hit and user must able to debug app successfully.
### Actual Behavior
Connection to the debugger is lost and app crashes with an error, 2019-01-11 10:27:16.744 XiOSDebugging[2297:333230] error: * Assertion at /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/external/mono/mono/mini/debugger-engine.c:359, condition `ji' not met

### Environment
```

	Package version: 518000225

=== Xamarin.Profiler ===

Location: /Applications/Xamarin Profiler.app/Contents/MacOS/Xamarin Profiler

=== Updater ===

Version: 11

Hash: 65ec520f

=== Xamarin.iOS ===

Hash: 327c0a8d
Branch: master
Build date: 2019-01-08 23:25:33-0800

=== Xamarin.Android ===

Not Installed

Android Designer EPL code available here:

```
